articles.title: Russia Says It Will Quit the International Space Station After 2024
articles.description: The announcement could lead to the end of two decades of post-Cold War cooperation in space between the United States and Russia, which jointly built and operate the station.
articles.content:
Without cooperation with the west, the Russian space program is impossible in all its parts, including the military one, Dr. Luzin said.

articles.author: Emilee Speck
articles.title: Relentless attack by fire crews help slow the spread of California’s Oak Fire burning near Yosemite
articles.description: The Oak Fire, which is burning near Yosemite National Park in California, continues to grow in size, but thanks to a relentless attack by fire crews from the ground and air, its spread has been slowed.
articles.content: MARIPOSA COUNTY, Calif. – The Oak Fire, which is burning near Yosemite National Park in California, continues to grow in size, but thanks to a relentless attack by fire crews from the ground and air,… [+2926 chars]

articles.title: Suspected Dallas airport shooter told cops she was Chris Brown's wife: report
articles.description: Portia Odufuwa, 37, remained in a hospital Tuesday morning after being shot and wounded by cops as she opened fire inside Dallas Love Field airport on Monday, police said.

articles.author: Anna Cooban, CNN Business
articles.title: The EU has agreed to ration gas, but some countries put up a fight
articles.description: The European Union has agreed to ration its natural gas this winter to prevent a severe supply shock. But the bloc has watered down its ambitions by offering countries some significant leeway.
articles.content: The European Union has agreed to ration its natural gas this winter to prevent a severe supply shock. But the bloc has watered down its ambitions by offering countries some significant leeway.

articles.title: Heat wave: Most of western Washington under heat-related advisories
articles.description: Most of western Washington will be under an Excessive Heat Warning or a Heat Advisory through Friday as temperatures are expected to be in the 90s.
articles.content: Most of western Washington will be under an Excessive Heat Warning or a Heat Advisory through Friday as temperatures are expected to be in the 90s.
